Christians also believe that [[God]] felt so much '''agape love''' for man that he sacrificed his son for them. John the Apostle wrote, "For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have everlasting life. For God sent not his Son into the world to condemn the world; but that the world through him might be saved." (John 3:16-17 [[KJV]])
 
Christians also believe that [[God]] felt so much '''agape love''' for man that he sacrificed his son for them. John the Apostle wrote, "For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have everlasting life. For God sent not his Son into the world to condemn the world; but that the world through him might be saved." (John 3:16-17 [[KJV]])
    −
Many Christian [[Theology|theologians]] see God as the source of love, which is mirrored in humans and their relationships. "He that loveth not knoweth not God; for God is love." (1 John 4:8 [[KJV]]])
+
Many Christian [[Theology|theologians]] see God as the source of love, which is mirrored in humans and their relationships by being created in his image. "He that loveth not knoweth not God; for God is love." (1 John 4:8 [[KJV]]])
